questions.text: "The Spine" was released in what year?
questions.explanation:
2004.

	Released on July 13 in the US and July 5 in the UK.

questions.text: While the previous albums "Mink Car" and "No!" had featured the Band of Dans on most tracks, "The Spine" sadly did not.  Which Dan had moved on?
questions.explanation:
Dan Hickey.

	Dan Hickey played drums on two songs from "The Spine" which had previously appeared on the EP "Indestructible Object."  For the rest of the album, the drummer's chair was occupied by Marty Beller.

questions.text: What will "make you beg", "make you scream", and "make you fall in love"?
questions.explanation:
Spines.

	"Spines" is one of two very short tracks, along with "Spine", that serve as title tracks of sorts.

questions.text: The ending of John Linnell's experimental film is guaranteed to do what?
questions.explanation:
Make your face implode.

	"I don't know what makes your face implode, but that's the way the movie ends."  This rocking song kicks off the album.

questions.text: What is NOT missing in the "world before later on", according to John Flansburgh?
questions.explanation:
Robot.

	"The World Before Later On" laments the future that was promised in the past, but never delivered.

questions.text: In "Broke in Two," John Linnell misunderstands his significant other's words.  What does he think she says?
options: I'm in love with your mother
questions.explanation:
I'm an orangutan.

	Her phrase was in fact "I'm gonna run you down."  Perfectly understandable mistake.

questions.text: John Flansburgh sings of his friend the natural dancer: "When it comes to opera, she is __________."
questions.explanation:
Ossified.

	"...so all of you operas better step aside."  From the song "Damn Good Times".

questions.text: "Au Contraire" describes a poker game I'd give anything to watch.  Who is NOT taking part in this high-stakes pasttime?
questions.explanation:
JFK.

	Ms. Foster has two pair, whereas Maestro Bach holds three of a kind.  Gandhi believes his full house will blow the audience's mind, but apparently he is mistaken.

questions.text: "Thunderbird" makes a sly reference to what Beach Boys song?
questions.correct: Fun Fun Fun & Fun, Fun, Fun
questions.explanation:
Fun Fun Fun & Fun, Fun, Fun.

	"We'll have fun fun fun until T-Bird takes her dad away."

questions.text: In the last song on the album, what can't John Flansburgh hide from?
questions.explanation:
His mind.

	"I can't hide from my mind, though I try, try try..."  An elegant closer to an excellent record.
